intro: Sisymbrium hirtulum, commonly known as hairy mustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are alternate, serrated, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Sisymbrium hirtulum is an annual plant that produces small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds.
